app.containers.AccessibilityStatement.as: The accessibility of this site was evaluated by an external entity not involved in the design and development process as can be identified on this {statusPageLink}.
app.containers.AccessibilityStatement.co: This site is optimised for Google Chrome, version 80 and later. It is also designed to be fully compatible with NVDA software.
Compatibility with browsers and assistive technology
We strive to make our content inclusive for all. However, in some instances there may be inaccessible content on the platform as outlined below:
Fully conformant: the standard content fully conforms to the accessibility standard without any exceptions.
app.containers.AccessibilityStatement.cu: Current accessibility standard of the site:
app.containers.AccessibilityStatement.ex: Our online workshops have a live video streaming component, which do not currently support subtitles.

Our digital engagement platforms facilitate user-generated content posted by individuals and organisations. It is possible that PDFs, images or other file types including multi-media are uploaded to the platform as attachments or added into text fields by platform users. These documents may not be fully accessible.
app.containers.AccessibilityStatement.fe: We welcome your feedback on the accessibility of this site. Please contact us via one of the following methods:
app.containers.AccessibilityStatement.in: CitizenLab is committed to ensuring digital accessibility for people with disabilities. Current and relevant accessibility standards are applied in our on-going efforts to improve the user experience for all who visit and use our platforms.
app.containers.AccessibilityStatement.pa: A statement on the accessibility of this website
app.containers.AccessibilityStatement.re: We aim to respond to feedback within 1-2 business days.
app.containers.AccessibilityStatement.sc: Screen reader bugs may occur with different browser/screen reader combinations. Bugs can be reported through the feedback process outlined below.
app.containers.AccessibilityStatement.te: The accessibility of this site relies on the following technologies to work:

app.containers.CookiePolicy.advertisingC: As CitizenLab, we don’t use advertising tools on the participation platforms, but some (local) governments and organisations do. {advertisingLink} is the most used tool for this. This allows them to learn what type of users took certain actions, and to build Facebook advertising campaigns based on that knowledge.
app.containers.CookiePolicy.analyticsCon: We only use mass analytics. Meaning that no individual data are used, and that you’re browsing our platform anonymously. These aggregated data, or mass analytics, show us which pages are the most and least popular and see how visitors move around the platform. This is necessary information for continuous improvement of the user experience. {analyticsLink} is our primary tool for analytics.
app.containers.CookiePolicy.cookiePolicy: A detailed explanation of how we use cookies on this platform
app.containers.CookiePolicy.cookiesListT: You can find a full, up-to date list of 3rd parties and {cookiesListButton}.
app.containers.CookiePolicy.functionalCo: The main functional tool we use in this regard is {functionalLink}. This tool allows us to talk to you in a direct manner when visiting the platform. This way, we could show you around, ask for feedback on the platform… The cookie allows us to continue this conversation when you come back. Off course, still without knowing who you are. When logged in, we use them to be able to send you in-app and email notifications on certain events relevant to you. These notification settings can be changed at any time on your user profile page.
app.containers.CookiePolicy.intro: As most websites, we use cookies to optimise the experience you and other visitors have on this platform. Because we want to be fully transparent on the why & how of this cookie use, you’ll find all details below, in as clearly written wording as possible. Cookies used on our platform are never used to identify and track specific users, they don’t "know who you are". Important to stress though, is that they do track technical data, such as a browser info, approximate location and an IP address. Although they are not used in such a way, in combination with other data sources, this could lead to an identification.
app.containers.CookiePolicy.whatAreCooki: Cookies are little text files which are stored on the browser or on the hard drive of your computer or mobile device when you visit a webpage or application. Cookies remember your actions and preferences. Logged in last time? A cookie will make sure you’re automatically logged in the next time you visit us. Visited the platform two weeks ago? A cookie will prove helpful to highlight what has been added to the platform in the last two weeks. More info on cookies in general, can be found in {wikipediaCookieLink}.
app.containers.CookiePolicy.whatCookiesC: Several third party tools are used on each of our participation platforms. These tools in turn use cookies to be able to function.

containers.Admin.onboarding.HTMLDescript: This page will be your guide
containers.Admin.onboarding.decideArticl: Add topics to inputs, move inputs from one phase to another, change their status or mark them as spam.
Get immediate and easy-to-grasp analytics, and monitor closely what’s happening on the platform.
containers.Admin.onboarding.engageArticl: Send them an invitation, give them admin or moderator rights and add a brief personal message explaining what they can do.
Add a personal message with a clear call-to-action. If you have a list of email addresses from people that participated in an offline event, easily add this list to the platform.
Inform your audience on a project entering a new phase, invite them for a project related event, warn them on an approaching deadline, etc.. You can do all this by creating custom email campaigns.
Send emails to keep your users updated
containers.Admin.onboarding.giveFeedback: Give feedback by adding or changing the status or providing an update.
containers.Admin.onboarding.manageArticl: Create groups to be able to contact specific groups or define permissions per group.
containers.Admin.onboarding.setupArticle: Projects are the beating heart of the platform. Admins and project moderators can customize and edit the projects at any time: information, files, images, areas, timeline, participation methods, planned activities, etc...
You can ask your users additional information while registering. Use the registration fields to get better insights, or to segment your users into groups, for example by age, area, interests, etc...
Define what you want to know from your users
A personalized widget brings people from other websites to your platform.
Link the platform to third party websites using a widget
containers.Admin.onboarding.title: Guide
